description.narrative: IFC''s investment will be used for early exploration activities. Development impacts for exploration activities are typically limited and at this stage mainly limited to some local employment and procurement. If the exploration efforts are successful, significant development impacts are expected to be realized, including: i) Creation of local employment opportunities through direct hiring and indirectly through PetroNova''s contactors. ii) Fiscal benefits to the Government of Colombia through royalties and income taxes. iii) Procurement of oilfield services and supplies from local and regional sources, thus fostering local economic development.

PetroNova Inc., is a small independent oil and gas exploration company with operations in Colombia and listed on the TSX Venture Exchange. The company has interests in five exploration blocks located in the Caguan-Putumayo Basin and the Llanos Basin, namely the PUT-2, the Tinigua, CPO6, CPO7 and CPO13. According to its business plan, the company is carrying on an exploration program that includes acquisition of seismic and drilling of exploration wells. The Project consists of the exploration program for 2012 and first quarter of 2013.

name.narrative: PetroNova is headquartered in Calgary, Canada. Its operational office is in Bogota, Colombia. The company will undertake exploration activities in five onshore blocks in Colombia: PUT-2, located in the southwest portion of the Caguan-Putumayo Basin, within the municipal jurisdiction of Mocoa Villagarzon, Puerto Guzman and Puerto Caicedo in the Department of Putumayo and Piamonte in the Department of Cauca. Tinigua, located in the northern part of the Caguan-Putumayo Basin, under the municipal jurisdiction of Uribe in the Department of Meta. CPO 6, CPO 7 and CPO 13 located in the Llanos Orientales Basin, within the municipal jurisdiction of Puerto Lopez and Puerto Gaitan in the Department of Meta, and Mani in the Department of Casanare.
